children.subject:
First semester:

CS61A, EE16A, Math 53, and a breadth

Second semester:

CS61B, EE16B, Physics 7A, and R1B

I'm also getting 2 units from an elective that I plan on taking every semester.
What were your courseloads for the two previous semesters?
EE 123 is arguably the highest workload EE course you could take as well. Please don't do this to yourself in Spring 2021 lol.
Ye I’ll probably end up swapping out 162 to Fall. How is the courseload for 186?
CS 186 has medium workload based on @8242. I am sure it has lower workload than 162

Isn't CS 182 often not offered in the fall? If so, I would recommend altering your schedule slightly and skipping CS 188 and just self-studying it at a later time (all the materials are available online and there's even an edX course). That should free up some space in your schedule.

Also, you could take CS 191 having completed just CS 170 and Math 110, but I would recommend taking Physics 137A at some point since you need to be fluent in the language of quantum mechanics to understand quantum computing. It may be quite challenging otherwise.
From the website, both CS 189 and CS 162 have pretty high workloads. It is not recommended to take them together. Also, CS 182 is often offered in fall.

You might feel a bit difficulty with the combination of CS 170 and EE 126 as your first experience of upper-division classes will be a combination of two hard ones, but I think I can overcome it (needless to adjust it just because I said they are hard: you inevitably need some manageable hardship in order to prepare for your later schedule).

I also think there is no need to take Stat 20 after you have taken courses that cover its material (if for econ prerequisites, change it to another worthwhile class). And I agree with the anon above that you need to seriously consider the combination of 189 and 162. I do not advise against it, but do not underestimate it.

Also, I think it is good to have a general plan, but I admonish you not adhere to it too closely. Some courses might not even be offered in the semester that you plan to take them.

Thanks for the advice! I just didn’t know too much about the stat curriculum and I didn’t take stats in high school so I just threw stat 20 in there, but after doing a bit more research it does seem like stat 135 is more along the lines of what I’m looking for so thank you again for suggesting that!

probably swap 162 and 186 b/c 123 does not have light-workload like 120, otherwise it looks fine. 

not sure why you are taking stat 20 though. maybe take stat 135 if you are interested in stats?

history.content:
Are there any semesters on here that seem way too hard? I don't really know much about the course load for upper division EECS courses, but I want to take as many as possible, and I have put the ones I am interested in on here as a potential plan.

For reference, I have managed to maintain a 4.0 so far in my first two semesters while taking 18 units each semester, but I'm not sure if the lower division courseloads are comparable to anything here.

Any advice is appreciated! Thanks!
history.subject: Course Plan Advice
